The crepes here are as good as the reviews suggested. We loved it so much that we had to order a second. Highly recommended.
Great food and staff. Food was excellent price is good. The inside is comfy and the service is pretty quick. Thank you!

This review is purely based on whether or not going to this place is worth it. We went twice and the line is out the door. So you'll wait between 20-60 minutes just to put in your order. Then, you can wait 10 minutes or 20 to get your food. The food IS GOOD. But for the price and the portion size, not worth it. Spent $30 on two people and I'm still hungry after. The servers work hard and are nice as they can be in such a fast paced place. It's honestly a fine place. But again, for the price, wait, and portion size, it's not worth it. SF has tons of good food. This isn't the only spot in town.

Honey Honey Cafe was worth the uphill journey while visiting San Fran...This place has it all..The food was great..the pancakes were actually fluffy and light..the eggs (over easy not runny) great..not to mention the fresh squeezed OJ.. This is not your run of the mil greasy spoon. This guy cares and that is passed along in his food (the taste and presentation) and service. The music was on par as well.  You need to come..sit..eat...Then bring g your friends. NUF SAID

Liked the vibe, food was ok at best. I ordered the eggs florentine with spinach but I found the sauce to be a little bland and the eggs undercooked —got a little grossed out to be honest. The home friends were tasted dry and stale as if they sat out way too long.

Nice place, love the fresh orange juice and coffee. Plus good music. I was disappointed by the strawberry Nutella crepe. Strawberries are cooked not fresh, not to my liking. The Belgium Waffle is good.

I had pretty high expectations. Was keen to have a nice breakfast before flying back to England. The eggs were undercooked, pancakes were average and coffee was ok. Definitely not as good as other reviews, would probably avoid in future.
The potatoes were delicious and so was the omelet

Pretty good crepes. I had the basic Lemon crepe and it was good but thats a hard one to mess up. My daughter had the strawberry Nutella and my husband the salmon Benedict. They both enjoyed their meals. The fries were nice and crisp, not dry or under seasoned. I would say the food is great, but not necessarily worth the 30 minute wait. I would go in less busy times though.

Good Breakfast, no long wait, orange juice was amazing, decent black coffee. I got their eggs benedict and it was nothing special but my partner got a torino crep whoch was very light and good. Their potatoes on the aide where perfect, nice and cooked with a little crisp! Service was fast, food was good, and resturaunt was clean.

Delicious. I had the iced chai and the Eden crepe. The iced chai wasn't too sweet in my opinion which was great and that made it easy to drink. The Eden crepe was lovely. There was a bit of a queue when I arrived and I can see why.  Would recommend!

Come early to avoid the long line. The food was ok, typical breakfast. The lady at the counter couldn’t keep up with the orders, flustered at 8am(please open earlier). There was kind of disorganized harmony, you can see the kitchen had their rhythm going but the counter person wasnt keeping up. A long line of waiting to order hungry people(snaking all the way to the street corner), ubereats/doordash on the side, then me(ordered online). The counter person had 2-3 support staff fixing all the orders for her. Organization and leadership will go a long way. You will keep people moving, get more money on the cash register that way, just a suggestion

Crepes galore, any crepe you could imagine.  Sweet, savory, even plain. Plus burgers, salads and more.  My favorite part of my visit, though, was how efficiently everything was run. The line was long, but by the time I got to order, I had a place to sit and my food was brought fairly quickly. The staff worked to get spots clean and get customers what they needed.

Fast, furious and efficient is how I classify our weekday breakfast there. The place is bustling and noisy, so don't go expecting a quiet start to your day. Order at the counter and grab a number for your table. The food is basic but good diner-level fare  (complete with Welch's jelly and butter packets) - with crepes as an added twist. Espresso was thankfully good.  Noisy dining room making the loud pop music piped in quite inexplicable.
Good food. Many sorts of different dishes with great flavor.

Birthday breakfast outing... Should have gone to Jack in the box. Went in shortly after opening on 10/13. Bloody Mary was gross, veggies in omelette were way under cooked, egg was dry, counter girl seemed rushed or annoyed. Never got checked on as other people did, didn't get prebussed like other tables did. Overall I felt unappreciated/unwelcome or like I was being a bother. Was going to order a crepe for dessert to go but decided not to. The potatoes were great and the mimosa was amazing.
Great crepe, fast service even with a line out the door.

Delicious. Have ordered from them numerous times and, despite some issues with how things are holding up to delivery-person's handling, still great!  Had only recently actually gone to the location for brunch. The food is even more amazing fresh off the stove!  Would go again. Best crepes I've had in San Francisco.
Great crepes stuffed with food. Bring your appetite.
Quick no fuss cafe with an extensive menu and curbside dinning.

A group of 4 of us went here for breakfast and the line was out the door. However, they kept the line moving and we ordered within 10 minutes and then within 20 we had our food. We were very impressed with the flow of the small place. The food was delicious and the size of servings were great. I would highly recommend everything about this place. Homemade and plenty of options.

Delicious!  We decided to try Honey Honey due to several recommendations.  So glad that we did.  We had the Miami heat and Eden crepes.  They were scrumptious!  Employees are busting their butts.  Great mael.at great prices.  We will definitely return and we absolutely recommend this establishment.

The food was pretty good, but we weren't given our receipt, our order was not taken properly, and we were charged for three drinks instead of two.  When I pointed out the overcharge, the guy looked at me as if I was stealing food from the mouths of his children and shoved me the money from the tip jar.  The service is way below acceptable, in my opinion.  And I couldn't withhold the tips, since the payment is taken right after ordering.

Really nice. Their crepes are excellent (both the savory and sweet) and they come with quite a hearty portion of fresh fruit / salad / potatoes on the side . Was honestly super impressed by how tasty and fresh the fruit was, especially in winter! Staff is also very nice.
Tasty!  The Breakfast Crepe was excellent.  If you come at breakfast, be prepared to wait.  If you have time - it is worth it.

The place has a good variety of food from Italian to Mexican. I tried the huevos rancheros, the crean Benedict eggs and a crepe and I did not like any of them. They were fast made, careless and the flavor was not good. The servers are fast and friendly. I think since they have to many customers and they try to serve fast, the food lose quality.
DELICIOUS breakfast, good prices!!   👍🏼☺️🥓🍳☕️🍞 …
Great breakfast spot while visiting the area,  large menu selection and incredibly accommodating staff if you have dietary preferences/ restrictions
Great breakfast joint, awesome crepes! Yummy pancakes too

A great selection of sweet or savory crepes along with more traditional breakfast and lunch options. Tried to get in on a Sunday and the line was out the door. Tried again Monday and I'm glad I did. The crepes were amazing! The house coffee is forgettable but not bad. A bit pricey for breakfast but portions are generous and presented well.
This place is OK, food is not bad, but the lack of good atmosphere make this place forgettable.

This review is from a visit in September. Long line and tight seating, but the food was well worth it. Although this place is best known for its crepes, I broke from tradition and had the Belgian waffle. Topped with whip cream and fresh fruit, it was amazing and one of the best I've ever had. Husband had a crepe he really enjoyed too. Also the orange juice is literally freshly squeezed!
Good coffee, good food. Easy wait even if the line is at the door.

This was a short walk from our hostel and smelled so good from outside - we were not disappointed! Their crepes were fresh and delish. We had the strawberry/Nutella and the Torini crepes - so good and plenty of fillings. Also had the tofu scramble; also yummy. Food was prepared fresh and was exactly as ordered. When you order hot tea, you get the whole pot!! We loved the intercontinental feel/vibe of this place.

This place is so popular. I got here for breakfast at 8 on Saturday, and it was perfect timing: a long line built up after me very soon. I ordered a chicken pesto crepe (came with potatoes) and a blintz. Both were delicious and so fulfilling that I did not feel hungry until in the afternoon. The service was prompt and friendly, and the prices were great. Certainly the best breakfast place in the vicinity of Union Square. P. S., pay with cash and receive a 3.95% service discount.

Very hot, fresh, and excellent food! I loved that they had an excellent variety of breakfast juices and smoothies here! Even though the line looked intimidating, the staff here was turning the tables around very quickly. I was able to have a seat and have my food delivered to me in a reasonable time right before my way to the airport. The next time I visit SAN FRAN, I will stop by here again!

The breakfast here was absolutely amazing! The waiting time was quick, and when we got our order the waitress was very polite and got our orders ready in no more than 20 minutes. Heh, I know you should never eat at the same place twice in San Francisco, but me and my party of 4 couldn't resist stopping by again during our visit. I'd definitely recommend for anybody stopping by in the Bay Area!
The food was great, the service was fast for how busy they are in the AM BUT the cleanliness of the place could improve a lot.  Overall, good place! I would return.
Excellent menu. Pretty good price for the portions. Breakfast crapes, with the delicious pure-orange juice. $$/$
Great food, average prices, awesome service :)
The food was wonderful!  Very happy tummy!
Delicious food at a good price. We got our table number as we were in line so we didn't have to worry that there wouldn't be a table. If this were in my home town, I would be there once a week!

Very good and tasty. I usually go for a dessert crepe, but it was morning, so I decide to go for a savory breakfast crepe and it was very good. My husband got the two, two, and two, which is just as good as anywhere else. The crepe on the other hand was delicious. Hoping to go back before we leave and try one of their Nutella ones. Almost everyone sitting in the place has one of those. Definitely worth checking out.
Very yummy sweet and savories. Miami Heat was great and so was the one crepe!

So delicious! I went for breakfast and lunch and I'm not sure which is better! Definitely try one on the crepes. Even if you haven't had a crepe before, you will find something you like regardless if you have a sweet to our savory pallet. The portions are plenty to fill you up and while the line can seem quite long at times, their service is spot on to get you in and get you fed! It's even perfect if you are going stag or with the whole family.

WOW! So this is absolutely amazing!  So many savory and sweet options (or both).  Group of four - we tried many!  Salmon Benedict, chicken burrito, crab cake Benedict, churrizo scramble, blintzes.  Limited bar menu.  Staff were hustling to serve people as quickly as possible.  On Sunday there was a good hour wait (they do not take reservations).  The line never ended when we were there! But the wait was well worth it.

Great place and lovely owners. We had a great chat with the owners and they are lovely people. The place is always busy and you should be expecting to stand in line to order. However, it is worth the wait. Their omelettes are really good and i recommend the Acapulco or Athens.  The place has a family feel which i appreciate a lot. The place gets really busy on the weekends so you better show up before 7:00 AM.
Fantastic place, absolute must with nice seating and atmosphere, and absolutely unreal food, it's about 60 dollars for what you see in the below picture. Highly recommended!

Very busy place for brunch on a Monday so we had high hopes going in. Ultimately ended up being a pretty average experience. The crepe I ordered was good, but nothing special and couldn't get elsewhere for cheaper. The sausage/eggs combo that my friends ordered was highly disappointing for the price and looked like something you'd order at a cheap diner. The service was a little slow, but not extremely slow to the point of it being frustrating. The one redeeming factor is that at least the staff were very friendly. Based on the reviews both here and on other review sites (and the prices), we were expecting a lot more, but got a very middle of the pack experience instead.

We finally went on a day when there wasn't a long line. My husband and I were not impressed with our meals. His salmon Benedict tasted wet and limp and my crepe was ok. A little too sweet for me. I've had a better crepe other places. I tried another visit to this place and got a ham, egg and cheese croissant sandwich and was still unimpressed. I've had a great ham, egg, and cheese croissant somewhere else for half the price. The service this time wasn't good even though there weren't many people in the restaurant. Don't know why but now I'm sure the long lines are from tourism and extra PR around hotels near Union Square.
had the philly steak cheese crepe and crab cake crepe. One tasted like cardboard and the other fishy, wouldn't recommend. Potatoes were eh......

Super yummy crepes! The line takes a while but it's not too bad. It was just going out the door when I went and I was able to order in 20-30 minutes I think. The food comes fast once you order. I had the Half Moon Bay (the one with crab cake). It was good, but the crab cake was very average, not too exciting. My friend had the pesto and really liked it. We shared a strawberry nutella, which was very tasty. Overall, I would recommend!
Excellent service.  Even though the staff was overwhelmed with people, they maintained friendly demeanor and professionalism.  Food was decently priced and very tasty.

Amazing breakfast for our mini-trip in SF!!! Long queue but totally worth waiting !!! You should definitely try their crepes. The restaurant is cute and lovely. Lots of choices made us hard to choose, totally energized after that .
Food was pretty good and they got through the VERY long line relatively quickly. You'll just need to be a bit patient.
Decent food, but the place felt a little dirty. Definitely not worth 4 stars but is a decent casual food spot.
Full with a line for a reason: great breakfast in a classic diner atmosphere.

To be honest! I just love this place ! I’m so happy that I accidentally discovered it and fell in love with it the moment I walked in . Their food is just so tasty and finger licking good. The owner is just an amazing person who took the time to get to know us and even remembered our names the second time we came . She gave us dessert on the house and was just wonderful. I’m just happy that I found a place that has great food and amazing customer service in SF.

Waited over thirty minutes to place my order on a "less busy than usual" Friday 10am. Not that bad. But I was forced to wait twenty minutes for the food because the staff forgot which table the order went to. Instead of being proactive, they waited for the customer to walk up and ask where the order was. Thankfully they didn't apologize for the mishap on their part and the food was perfectly cold so that made up for it.
Great and tasty with huge variety of options. Good price to value
Service and food was on point.

Nice local restaurant! The food was great but as mentioned by others the menu is a tad overwhelming to read and expect a long line! The dining area could be more spacious also..it's a little cramped. However, I found that regardless of these inconveniences it was still worth it! Our breakfast was amazing and I would recommend to anyone in search of a delicious meal!
Line goes really fast! First come, first serve!

The food here is delicious! I had the smoked salmon omelette and a peanut butter crepe special which was to die for! You will wait in line for brunch, but one of the best things about this place is that they are EFFICIENT. They know what they're doing and the line moves fast. Highly recommend!

Great food. Took my friend there for brunch. Don't be afraid of the long lines. Their service is excellent and lines moves fast, food delivery is quick. I got the egg Florentine and hot chocolate. Yummy!!! I want to try the crepes next time 😊 …
Wonderful food that was made fresh!

If you enjoy being complained about openly in Spanish-( Sweetheart, we can understand you) and  having your food delivered to another table to magically reappear at your table seconds after going back to the kitchen, then waiting over an hour for a bagel sandwich this is the place for you! If that’s not your vibe, go ahead and avoid this spot. A lot of potential, poor execution.
Food was ok.  Music kinda loud for a breakfast place.  Could not hear the person next to me talk. Music also inappropriate for kids.  May just pick up food for takeout next time.

It's pretty basic chain food. The good thing is you can get dinner pretty late and when they messed up our order they gave us a second one for free. I ate the wrong order and my friend ate the right one. They serve breakfast late into the night and close at about 10  The place looks cute and the layout is nice and open, fun music mostly from the 90s. Servers are good.
Very delicious! Good music and good service!

Nice little place for breakfast and lunch near Union Square. They have a lot of crepe/breakfast and sandwich/salad choices and the food is very good. Lines can get long. They could use two people up front for sure (one on the register, one making drinks) so it can take a while to get your order placed and seated. Family and I had two different kinds of crepes and the breakfast burrito. All of it was very good. Crepe texture was spot on. Light and crispy edges. Toppings had excellent flavor. Burrito had flavorful chorizo, eggs and cheese.  Now, why the 4/5 stars? Value for the money.  I KNOW it's San Francisco, I KNOW it's the most expensive city in the country to live in, but....but.... $8 for one crepe......ahhh.....geez.....OK. Whew, I had to get that off my chest.
Was in San Fran for 3 days and ate here to of them. Amazing food! The only knock is that the line is always out the door so they need another register. Worth the wait though.
From the east coast, by far one of the best pancakes I had in my entire life. Everytime I visit San Francisco, I always go out of my way to visit this place once during my trip.

Good crepes, tasty house made citrus water, and nice atmosphere. Even though the dining room had a dozen open tables one night we were there, the waiter kicked us out because we had been there too long according to his judgement. We had been there for over an hour and a half, so it wasn't the end of the world, but his attitude was a little abrasive considering how much food we had ordered and how empty the place was.

One of at least three times I've been to this nice restaurant. I always get the California or grilled chicken sandwich. The menu, posted on the wall to your right as you walk in, is fairly simple: crepes, salads, sandwiches, soups, and desserts. I am sure they're all good, and all items come out of the kitchen quickly. This isn't fast food, however. It's good food, prepared speedily.

Long wait. The crab cakes were delicious.  Only reason I️ didn’t pick 5 stars is they lost our order and we waited 40 minutes for our food. Besides that I️ would say it was very good. If you try the honey honey cake, make sure they warm it up for you. It was great with coffee.

Do not get confused by the ratings. The only good thing about this is the price. Not too expensive. We ordered food and when we received it came on chipped plates and not very appealing presentation. The cooks in the bag are sweating and not using hair nets nor gloves. My friend found a hair in his food and got reimbursed thankfully. The food is edible, but cold and you can taste the lack of quality ingredients. I would suggest another brunch place.
Great food! I loved the Milano omelette and fruit cup. Long line but it moved fast. They are a well oiled machine with orders, finding you a table, and getting food out quick.

I live near SF and have found this to be one of the best crepe shops there. Started with their dessert crepes, which are nothing short of exquisite, but after having several others have found this to be a restaurant good to bring my visitors to when they're viewing the city. Never had a bad experience so far, and the resteraunt has a really cozy feeling that leaves you feeling as warm as their fresh crepes.

I strongly recommend this place. Amazing food and friendly staff. Since I can not drink any dairy, I asked one of the staff names Hinda if they have Turkish coffee.  She said no but then she told me that she has her own Turkish coffee with her and she offered to make some for us. After few minutes, she came out with a pot of Turkish coffee in hand. I couldn't believe it. We asked how much we owe and she refused to take any money.  Then she went inside and came back with a bag of coffee and she gave it to us. She went above and beyond and made such an amazing experience for us. Thank you Hinda for your beautiful smile and kindness.

We arrived around 10 am and there was a line that almost went out the door. Surprisingly it moved fast and most people ordered to go. We got a table for four and one of the servers/cleaners told us to sit by a table next to the door. We waited for her to clean it but she never came so we decided to sit at a different table that was far away from the door and wind. There aren't any hostess for you to sit, it's like a Starbucks but more spacious and of course better food.

Really good for breakfast, went multiple times when in town.  Savory and sweet crepes I tried were all good, as well as the croissant sandwich and omelettes. Get there by 8a to avoid long lines, it can get crowded pretty quick.  Seems expensive but really on the lower end of SF prices.  Order at the counter but delivering food to the table can be a touch slow and have seen some orders getting mixed up.

Had breakfast at Honey Honey.  Very busy and a bit noise but your in the heart of San Francisco.  Fresh orange juice was really good but the food took a little long to get out.  Food quality was good but my college had the pan cakes and it was under cook.  Over for a decent breakfast not a bad place to go but not a memorable experience.
The food was wonderful ! I would certainly recommend this place for a good breakfast !

Ate here twice for breakfast in the span of our 5 day span in San Francisco. Place is always crowded with a line out of the door for a good reason. Food is absolutely delicious, and you have to try the orange juice. Pretty fast service, and free refills on coffee. Cannot recommend this place enough.

I gave this place 4 stars.  Great atmosphere, available tables indoor and outdoor, food came out fast, and server was on top of things.  The only thing I didn’t care for was the breakfast menu was limited, and the food was so so.

Came here under recommendation from our hotel concierge, for a quick breakfast before we left San Fran. We had to line up for about 10min to order at the counter. We weren’t too happy about that but it was so busy we thought, this must be worth it..! I had a very delicious iced latte and a savoury ‘Torino’ Crepe, my daughter had a delicious bowl of porridge with fruits, and husband was pretty happy with his avocado bagel and freshly pressed orange juice. I’d go back!

This place is known for long waits if you go during prime time, but I understand why people wait in line.  The prices are great and they have a vast variety of breakfast options including crepes, both sweet and savory.  We tried both and enjoyed them.  The coffee was delicious also. It was slightly confusing for first time guests when it came to figuring out the table situation.  We opted to wait until we got to the register and were directed to a newly opened table with our number. I Noticed others confused about the tables and some tried to take them while waiting but were directed to wait.  Definitely go early! It starts to really pick up at 9 am.

Crepe was of good quality but the wait was insane. There was one large table ahead of us but we waited at least 30 minutes for two crepes. It smelled like dirty dish rags in the restaurant which always makes me nervous. Ok, but needs improvement overall.

Don't let the line scare you away! We waited approximately 40 minutes to place our order & pay. Crepes were totally divine. I got the breakfast crepe & my daughter got the Nutella crepe. We shared as they were a perfect complement to each other.
Get there early, even before they open if you can, this place gets busy fast. Food was really nice and filling. Good way to start the day

Long wait on a Sunday which is typical, but pretty delicious food that was worth the wait! If you order the Blintz crepe, it's definitely insta-worthy, but the inside was a bit too runny for my taste. The crab cake eggs Benedict though was delicious, and the potatoes were cooked perfectly! They also have freshly squeezed orange juice which is a plus. Giving it four stars though because I ended up finding a hair in my crab cake and they took a long time to make me a new one (or just forgot until I had to go back up there).. other than that though I would definitely come here again!
Best eggs Benedict ever. Crepes and Italian soda are good as well. They really hustle here. WORTH THE WAIT. The line was out the door so we almost left, I’m glad we waited.
Delicious food, great service. The dulce de leche crepe is soooo good ! Recommend this place !

It gets packed but the staff efficiently seats and cleans up after customers. You have plenty of time in line to review the menu so you can be prepared when you make it to the register to order. The food is well worth the wait and the latte just hit the spot for me.
Spent a week in San Fran and this became my morning stop, lots of options for breakfast! Loved starting my day here.

Large menu had everything we wanted. Outdoor seating during COVID. I had a chocolate strawberry crepe and mocha. My husband had eggs, bacon and a waffle with fresh squeezed OJ. My son had a chocolate waffle with milk. Delicious. This will be our go to breakfast spot in Union Square.

Good food, a lot of variations in the menu.  It looks busy going in but tables clear out quickly and line moves relatively fast.  We had a party of 5 and a stroller and the guy seating people ensured we got a table big enough and with a lot of space even though they have mostly small tables.

Plain crepe with syrup was good. Waffle was great. Avoided the coffee based on another review. Staff was attentive and helpful. Busy in the morning, but tables free up frequently, so you don't wait to long. Good breakfast stop!

Great food, there was a line on a Monday morning, i would suggest arriving before 8.  Food took a while but worth it.  Burrito was good but only had a teaspoon of sour cream at most, I would suggest asking for extra sour cream.  Don't sit on the benches if you're tall, or you'll be reaching down to your plate at your knees.
Food was really good and came out fast. The only reason why I’m taking away a star is because I think they need to do a better job cleaning their water cups and utensils.

2 stars because my wife liked her crepe. otherwise this place is total chaos and the food is not worth the hour wait. my omelet was overcooked and portions are small. saw 2 groups of people get their food before us even though we ordered 5 and 10 mins before them. no line then eat here. if there is a line then forget it.

Went in for some crepe desserts at night after dinner while walking around town. Atmosphere was quiet and cozy, staff seemed busy cleaning for the end of the night. We ordered the BLINTZ CREPÉ it was Delish. Food came out quickly, and was devoured even quicker. Decided to have some flavored water. Very refreshing, not too much flavoring, just right. Could see other customers happy with their food as well.
Small place but clean, very organized,  friendly happy stuff

So I've got to say I don't understand the hype for this place!! Waking up later than usual on a Sunday, this was not our first choice; however, the reviews brought us here. There were 5 of us, and since the place was really busy, I asked my friend to find a table while we were waiting in line to order. One of the staff members came by to her and told her that she needs to get up and that seating can be only assigned once we've ordered!!! Well, 10 minutes later we ended up getting the same table. Now on to the food: The food was just ok.. My potatoes were under-cooked while my friend's potatoes were over-cooked. Just your average comfort breakfast food... I really don't get the hype.. The staff turned out to be friendly at the end despite the initial encounter.

Good food but expensive.  A full breakfast with OJ and coffee costs $20.  I was a tourist needing breakfast in downtown San Francisco, and there seemed to be very few choices within walking distance of Union Square.  I tried Honey Honey and ordered the 2+2+2 platter -- 2 eggs, 2 pancakes, 2 slices of bacon.  The orange juice ($5 extra) was fresh-squeezed on the spot, and was delicious, but it was served at room temperature, not chilled.  I was satisfied with the breakfast, very tasty, but wanted to give a note of caution about the prices.

We went here on a Saturday morning. It was mobbed. The staff were a bit short with everyone.  A long line trailed out the door. The music was really loud so everyone was shouting at each other. The noise level was ridiculous.  The food wasn’t good either. The blintz was nothing like a blintz. The bagel stale. Sigh.  And it wasn’t very clean and the pain was coming off the walls in places.  Meh
Affordable breakfast in the center of San Fran. A little bit loud.

The crepes are a total treat. I tried the savory ones. Friends tried french toasts, waffles and fruit platters. All delicious and generous portions. Great place to have / pick up brunch. Extensive menu options.
Standard American food. Florentine eggs weren’t bad and Belgian waffles just okay. Wouldn’t come back. Ambiance is also not my kind of tea with chart topping songs and families.
A very long line and crowded ambiance. The food is very good, I recommend getting the salmon Benedict.

There was a huge queue to get in, then another queue to order. Overall it must have taken 45 minutes to order. I am not sure if this is because it was a holiday, or if it is like this every weekend.  There is a good selection of vegetarian options, although too much avocado for my liking. Still it wasn't hard to find something to my liking.  When the food arrived it was tasty, although a bit on the cold side. I might have gone for some dessert, but that would mean queuing up again. You have to know what you will want when you first order.
We had a party of 7, cafe was full and the host/busser found space for us. Efficient at getting guests seated and priorities and let's you know there will be a space for you.

The wait was long. While we waited a couple asked "why are you waiting in this line" we didn't really have an answer besides our friend wanted to eat there. After dinning though I can say we waited because... 1. Staff was very helpful and friendly. 2. Seating was very quick and easy... the staff move tables around and make tables work for the next person in line. 3. Food was very good.  Only reason I give it four stars is cause the price is a little high for what you get and the process to get a refill is a little annoying.

This place is ok, but super overrated. The line is long and moves somewhat slowly. The crepes and other dishes I've tried are average. There are a ton of options, so it's a good place to go if you have picky eaters. They do have really good fresh orange juice. Seating for large groups is limited. Cards, cash, and NFC payments are accepted.
Not the best service, but proper cups and no throwaway trash!!

I've visited San Francisco the past two years and this is my go-to place first thing in the morning. I'm vegan and they offer soy milk, granola, fruit, and/or oatmeal which were perfect for me. I would like to try their Tofu Scramble but it (very oddly) has eggs! Go figure. Bustling but efficient and the food is tasty and filling. The staff is friendly and they even gave me extra fruit at no cost. Yes, it's pricey (granola or oatmeal with soymilk & fruit is $9.45) but it's San Francisco so that is not a surprise. Opens at 7:30am every day so get there early or you will be waiting in line, but even the line moves fast. You order your food, they give you a number, and bring your food to you. I'd return again.

Worth the wait. This was our first time to San Francisco, and I read good reviews about Honey Honey. We did have to wait about 40 minutes to order, but it was worth it. It's a fun atmosphere, and a unique experience. They have a GIANT menu to choose from, but I don't think that you should leave without trying one of their crepes, it's like breakfast heaven.
It’s not bad, but it’s just kinda meh. Chorizo scramble tasted like frozen chorizo. Crab crepe tasted very fishy. Latte was chocolate flavored without telling me that (yuck). Just not for me.
Pretty small place, long line, and food was just ok. My sister got her phone swiped and she and the busser had to chase the thief down.

Delicious variety of food. My partner and I were feeling something sweet and savory so we got and shared the French toast and the salmon Benedict. The French toast was to die for!! The potatoes were nice and crisp. Our friend got a breakfast burrito which he also greatly enjoyed. Affordable, fast, and scrumptious.

This is a perfect place for an inexpensive, uncrowded dinner downtown.  The food is good, especially the potatoes, and the service is friendly.  Reasonable prices, plus counter service only, means your wallet gets a break.  It is open til late in the evening, but the crowds are there only in the morning, and they have plenty of burgers, sandwiches, salads, and soups to choose from.

My girlfriend and I waited for 30 min in line and another 20 min for our food. She ordered eggs Benedict with potatoes. They were ice cold. I ordered a Belgian waffle with a side of eggs and sausage. My eggs came out first and were  cold and my waffle and sausages never came out. I let the manager know and he was unprofessional and initially didn't want to give back my funds. Terrible experience. Don't go there.
Great breakfast place in Union Square..wish I had more time to enjoy it..crepes were delicious!!!! Great customer service

Food was good, took forever to even order our food. Line was to the door and they were training someone.  She had no idea.  I think when its as busy as it was judgment should have been used and training should have commenced after the rush was served. By the time we ordered and sat down and got our food, we didn't care to taste the food.  we were so hungry we inhaled it. I'd recommend the coffee.  I enjoyed that.

The best breakfast crepe ever: cheddar cheese, ham, onion, bell pepper over egg and wrapped in a delicious crepe.  And for dinner, a chicken pesto crepe: swiss, tomato, garlic, pesto, fresh basil, and chicken breast wrapped in a delicious crepe.  I used to go every morning when I was going through the credential program at San Francisco State back in 2001-02.  Abed, you’re a good man.  Thanks!

Decent way to start the day.  Ordered the crab cake florentine and was left wanting. The crab cake was tasty and offered a nice crunch, but one of the eggs was overcooked. My chai proved a light way to start the day and the potatoes were the highlight with a perfect amount of herbs, cooked perfectly to soaked up the extra hollandaise.  Also swapped with a friend for one of his salmon Benedict's. The salmon had such nice flavor and I think it was better than the crab cake one. The salmon, tomato, and english muffin left a textural gap though because everything was soft. The muffin probably just needed to be toasted longer.  My friends also had crepes, a strawberry-nutella and a an SBK. Both looked good and they told me it tasted good too.

Came here based on the reviews that I saw. It's above average in my opinion; amazing selection of sweet or savoury dishes but the interior just felt a bit dated. I visited towards the end of the day so there weren't any big crowds and no waiting in line to order. Staff weren't the friendliest but they weren't rude eiher.

Great service. Great food. Not the cheapest food you can get but the food price and quality matches the service. Amazing. It's not quiet though. If you need a quiet space to work, or are doing a phone or video interview, it won't be sufficient. The music will be blazing. However, the music choice is eclectic so it's nice
Crab cake Florentine is amazing. Potatoes fresh and not greasy. Good atmosphere and friendly staff
Order yourself, average food (not everything seemed to be freshly prepared). Very relaxed atmosphere.
Soooo good! Very helpful for our party of 6 and got our food out faster than I expected. I had the Baklava crepes and it was good!!! Would definitely recommend and come back again.

Come here for the chicken pesto crepe (or any other crepe for that matter) and the fresh squeezed orange juice. The normal dishes were good, but nothing special.  Don't be surprised if you have to wait in line for a bit to order your food, and or if table space is limited. The service is also not overly friendly or attentive.

We enjoyed the food here.  I found the menu, while offering a great selection a little overwhelming with the variety of choices.  The food was enjoyable but did not stand out as anything special.  As a counter service restaurant, the service was okay but, unfortunately, slower than I would hope.

Line was out the door, but moved pretty quick. You order at the counter, pick a table, and someone brings your food out. I had the Eggs Benedict - pretty good serving size and came with potatoes. The potatoes were spicier than I expected for breakfast potatoes, but still good.

Let me just start with the bad things first....... LONG LINES!!!!!! Honestly, its not a restaurant for a quick grab... lines could take up the whole block sometimes... and they way it works is that you go in... find a seat then get back in the line to order, but what irks me is that most times a table isn't ready so even if your food is done you would still have to wait till you get a table, and by the time you get to your table, if you need something else, like another hot chocolate... you have to re enter the whole line to get something, because there is nobody walking around asking, "is everything alright?" But the food is very good tho... fluffy waffles, AMAZING HOT CHOCOLATE!!!! And absolutely beautiful crepes!!!! Other than that, they are a 3/5 for me!!

If you want an unrelaxed zoo, come.  Otherwise, I don't recommend it at all.  The food is meh but inexpensive.  Perhaps the draw?  The menu looks to mimic Creperie. And don't worry about showing your vax card...they don't ask.

Tons of choices for everyone!  Great vibe, very efficient and friendly service.  Best coffee I've had since we arrived.  Only downside was my poached eggs were not quite cooked - do be sure to ask for them "medium"...will definitely be back when I return to San Fransisco!
Great food, prices ok.

Theres a line to order on the weekend, but the quality of the ingredients is great. A fruit cup is fresh fruit is literally fresh and appetizing. The potatoes were my favorite part, they a just right and add a bit of a crunch which I really enjoy crispy potatoes.

The only reason I'm giving this 3 stars is because the crepes was actually good. The strawberries weren't fresh and it took over a half an hour to get our crepe. We were one of 2 people that ordered and the people that got here 15 minutes after us got their crepes first.
This place is amazing. It gets really busy so come early or with time to spare. It’s worth the wait.

Good food but it's so so busy. Make sure you view the menu to know what you'd like before hand because you won't have much time to dwell on it. The food itself is very good and they treat you as best as they can with the rush of customers, they even find tables to accommodate for you so no need to worry about swooping in for a table. A bit too fast paced for my dinning preferences.
Huge wait, uncomfortable tables, mediocre eggs benedict and over-peppered hash browns. No thanks.

Good menus and tasty food, but the long lines to get in could be vastly speed up by better workflow. If cashier were not also responsible for preparing espresso-based beverages (maybe use a second person who could deliver them to the table the way the food is delivered), wait time would be seriously reduced and more than a third of the tables wouldn't be empty, waiting for their future occupants to get through the line.

A small corner café with a great menu! It gets really crowded and has limited seating so have someone in your party grab a table as soon as you see one! There was a line out the door when we arrived and it never got much shorter. Quite a variety on the menu plus they will try to accommodate special requests, like putting your favorite omelet into a crepe. Yum!
Busy, but quick. Delicious food, helpful staff.

Great casual place for crepes. We went evening but there was a queue outside for breakfast / brunch too which seems to be popular. I had the pesto crepe which was lovely and my husband had a breakfast crepe which he enjoyed. Very informal but great food.
Nice food and surprisingly not so oily. Go early to avoid long lines.
Awesome staff, great food. Place is super busy. Wait times about an hour on weekends so get coffee and get in line. You'll thank me later 🤗 …

Delicious breakfast crepe! We had the fruit as our side and a pot of Earl Grey tea. The fruit was a small bowl, but it was fresh.  And the tea was not very strong, so that would be the only reason for not giving 5 stars. We actually shared this and it was enough for both of us. Would definitely visit here again.

The line is long but they hustle through it so that there are constantly seats coming open as you order then they help you get seated. The food is really good, the crepes are tasty, the blintzes great, and everything else good, too. Be patient.

I was just looking for a quick bite near the hotel... WOW! This place is great!  The Dungeness are in season, so I tried the Crab Cake Benedict, but this is also a crepery, so my companion feasted on a Mediterranean Crepe chocked full of olives, onions, artichoke hearts, cheddar, feta and avocado. Both dishes were accompanied by the best home-style,  fried potatoes I've had in years.  This is a wonderful find in the Theater District near Union Square (and within the shadow of San Francisco's original Trader Vic's on Cosmos which closed in 2004). The sandwiches look great too, but breakfast is served daily until 3 pm.
Fresh orange juice is always a treat. My eggplant crepe was fine. Big portions but fairly greasy as it was heavy on the cheese. Not Sure If the crepe was totally cooked through

We are on vacation and found this place for breakfast.  So amazing,  went back.  I'd eat here every day,  it's so good! Had the Breakfast crepe... delish! And Belgian Waffle. Great taste and texture, and tons of whipped cream!
Hard to go wrong with crepes. Great selection and variety. My breakfast crepe was delicious and the fresh squeezed orange juice was a huge plus! Definitely reccomend.
Only one main complaint about this lovely place is their prices . $40 to $55 for a delivered meal.
Really delicious pancakes, quick and nice service!
So thankful for the kindness of the staff. They helped me when I was about to pass out due to pregnancy and were SO gracious. Plus delicious food!
Amazing food, great selection, service was prompt and friendly. I will be stopping here again!

Had the honey honey cake with some coffee which was very yummy but make sure you like really sweet food. Both the sweet and savory crepes are great. The service is quick and the servers and bussers are nice and efficient and helped us get a table once we were at the counter ordering.

Nice atmosphere but the food wasn’t great. I got the eggs Florentine which was soggy and I’m not even sure the English muffin was toasted. The egg whites were a little runny. The fresh squeezed orange juice was good!
It was so good! The restaurant is warm and cozy. Good prices and good service!
Really great breakfast place but they leave the door open and cold wind blows in the whole time, youre basically eating outdoors on cold days if you get stuck near the door

Great food, absolutely delicious!! So many different crepes to choose from, I got one with crab in it and want even disappointed! The line gets long in the morning, we even got there what we thought was early, so plan on having a bit of a wait

I was excited to try this place until I found out they do not serve plain fruit filled crepes. I settle for there 2,2,2; 2 pancakes 2 eggs, and 2 breakfast meats. I subbed the meat for potatoes. The potatoes where burnt, the coffee was burnt, the eggs were greasy and pancakes were pasty and topped with cheap syrup. I sure they have great dishes but the simple dishes need a lot of attention

If you order the BLINTZ ....although VERY GOOD.... the stuffing is runny....not thick and creamy like an authentic German BLINTZ.  THE FOOD IS GREAT. THE SERVICE VERY WELL ORGANIZED. long line but it moves fast..so don't walk away just because the line is out the door.  Crab very fresh....duhhhh. Fruits are really tasty also.

Absolutely delicious!!! The Chicken & Pesto Crepe and Mimosa were amazing!!!! We had a mis-understanding regarding my order and they went out of their way to make it right and even brought a delicious pastry to my table. It's a busy lil' spot... as I sit here typing, the line is out the door,  but I can understand why... it was DELICIOUS!!! 👅
Amazing meals at a great price. Huge selection of items to choose from.

Have just walked out of this place, I ordered the crab cake Florentine, the hollandaise had to have been off. I had to scrape it off my eggs, the taste was rancid, not palatable at all. I asked the wait staff to check with chef, who then went off and didn’t return to us. As we were leaving we had to go to the staff and ask what was going on with the hollandaise which he replied “they are going to switch it (the batch) with another one”. Pretty poor form after spending over $30 for 2 breakfast and 1 coffee.

Given all the rave reviews I expected more. The line was crazy long but you eventually get there. Food was good but not out of the ordinary. Better than fast food by a long shot. Prices were decent but just be prepared to wait.
Good food but busy. One out of two orders never came after an hr. Had to get a refund due to not having meal ready at all.

The food here is average to very very slightly ("above average" Some Dishes) I walked by this place on a Sunday. The line was super long and the inside was packed. I told my group that I was walking with we have to come back to try food from this joint. We all came back during to week. We ordered 5 different dishes from breakfast to lunch to dinner stuff, breakfast stops at 3pm. We all thought it was, just ok, not bad but just ok.  This Place is way too expensive for average at best food. 3 pancakes are 10 bucks lol. They weren't even huge. A side of bacon (3 Strips)  is almost 5 bucks plus an OJ and tax, thats over $20 for just ok food. Crepes are ok, chicken is ok, etc etc. The staff is super nice tho, service was good as well.  If you cant find or know of a place that's better, stop in. But those who are in the know or know great food when they taste it, pass on this place!

Situated on the corner, you usually wait outside and then wait to order before you get seated. Overall I waited about 20 minutes, which wasn't too bad. The restaurant still had a line when we were leaving at around 10:30ish. Their menu design is the same as the one at Crepevine and Whispers, but they definitely have a different variety and more crepes options! Pretty good portions like most breakfast places. I got the chorizo scramble and the Nutella + banana crepe. Super full afterwards, but very delicious. Would recommend.

Excellent place for breakfast ! We waited a long time but it was worth it ! Very well organized, the waiter is preparing tables as we order at the counter, no waiste of time. And it tastes so good. Their crepes are amazing !
Really great cafe. The crepes are delicious, and very large portions. Extensive menu selection. The staff is terrific, excellent service every time I have been here. Great local spot unique to SF

It's good food but the hype is more than reality. The burger is tasty, but not anything you will remember after a day. The crepes are very good, especially the sweet ones. If you have to choose, go for the sweet ones.

The line was quite long when we arrived but loved relatively quickly. Orange juice was delicious and food was good. I had the eggs benny and it was a good dish. Not my favourite eggs benedict, but quite good.  Service was excellent.
Love the crepes here. Whether is the savory ones or the sweet ones. And don't miss the freshly squeezd orange juice!

I've been here multiple times and it never disappoints. Expect to wait, but they move the line along pretty quickly. I've only ever gone for breakfast, but enjoy it everytime. The lemon crepe is delicious!!!
Top chocolate waffle. Bottom left Miami heat crepe. Athens omelette.

Great variety of breakfast menu! European, Mexican, vegetarian, I think it covers most tastes. Service is fast and efficient, table is assigned to you while you wait in line, according to number of people, before you reach the cashier to order.

Seems everyone wants breakfast here the day before Thanksgiving. All seats are full. Line out the door. I feel lucky to receive my eggs benedict immediately after finding a table for one. Potatoes were a bit over & dry, but the benedict was perfect. Good coffee, but the free water is PERFECT!

Food is good and the location is great right in the heart of San Francisco, but their service is kind of a mess.  Feels like they need another staff member or two.  The service was pretty slow both of the times I went.  I'd eat here again, but I don't think the wait matches with the food quality.  This place is good not great.
Very busy location, prepared to wait in line for about 10 mins. Food items between $11 - $18 range. Coffee and beverages under $5. Great service, and good Chai!
Pretty good place for breakfast in Union Square area...

The food was really good and the seating was handled pretty professionally, but nothing about this place really stood out. They have a huge menu full of good things to eat, but the line to order was horrible the day we went (took almost an hour) and the food wasn't that good. I recommend this place if you are a local and if the line is just right (not down the street).

When you walk to this place in the weekend during breakfast/lunch hours, you'll probably notice a long line outside. That's too bad, but it does show the food is good and it also is fairly priced. Look at Google Maps to see how crowded it is at a certain time and day, because a 'quick breakfast' might not be possible (due to the line)

Great variety of dishes to choose from! All of our food was good, and the atmosphere was cozy.  We had the Florentine Crèpe, Migas (which I can't seem to find on the menu now), and  Salmon Benedict. All of the dishes were tasty, but I'd definitely switch from my crèpe to that Benedict next time... it was wonderful.
We got the chicken pesto and strawberry Nutella crepes. They were absolutely delicious! Great place for breakfast or lunch
Had breakfast here on our last trip to San Francisco. Very convenient walk from our hotel. A little busy but service was still good and the food was great. Loved the croissant sandwich!

Friendly staff, yummy crepe, good breakfast potatoes, nice atmosphere. However, really long lines, mushrooms in the North Beach crepe underdone, chorizo scramble too spicy, chai way too sweet (was it made with syrup?). Maybe the staff is too rushed? Would recommend trying a dessert crepe instead of savory.
Really good crepes here. I really liked the pesto crepe plus the mocha. They have an extensive menu so it is hard to choose :D

Worst dining experience of our lives! Would NOT RECOMMEND.  A group of 8 of us from out of town decided to stop here for a weekend brunch, which of course is going to take more time, but we decided to wait. They make you stand in line for about 30+ minutes without a list you can put your name on or anywhere to sit. Which sucks, but we could have lived with.  They served our coffee boiling hot, and curdled the soy latte drink that 1 person ordered. When they tried to return it the barista said there's "no way to not curdle soy" and to just drink it anyways. Refused to accept it back. No one would seat us, and since everyone behind us in line took the tables we had to crowd 8 people around 2 small 2-person tables at either end of the restaurant. Of course once we were done eating they sat the group of people behind us and set some tables up for them.  When we got our food they left an INCH-LONG METAL SHAVING sticking out of the potatoes! When we tried to return it the owner of the restaurant laughed in our faces, threw us a $10 bill out of the register (NOT a full refund for the meal) and said they wouldn't do anything about it.  The drinks were boiling hot, the food was half cold, the service was beyond terrible and insulting. I'd recommend finding another brunch spot.

So, we used to love this place, but a recent experience made me feel like I should leave a review and stop frequenting this establishment. My partner and I called in an order and walked the couple blocks from our apartment to pick up our order. When we arrived, we were practically run over by someone that looked to be a manager with no mask nearly pushing us out of the entrance that we were trying to enter, who gruffly told us, "We're closed!". This person was obviously much more concerned about the person that was trying to collect a few scraps from an abandoned meal than he was about health and safety, or just even feigning politeness. While we were picking up our order, this man walked back in with the meal he had taken back from the person that was simply trying to collect what someone else left behind. I stared. I really didn't event know what to say. We picked up our order and left, deciding that this would be the best way to call them out on this poor behavior.

The line out the door tells you everything you need to know! I tried the special of the day which was a Philly Steak Crepe. The Crepe itself was perfectly cooked and the dish was fantastic overall. Definitely recommend this place to fellow Crepe lovers

Our family enjoyed coming here twice in four days. Can be a little loud aking with the music  but the quality of the food is great. Grilled chicken sandwich was a favorite as were the huevos rancheros which had a homestyle and rustic flavor to it.

A fantastic, hidden gem which serves good portions of breakfast, lunch, and a huge selection of crepes. The service was quick, the food was fantastic, and I have marked this place in my go-to spots when I return to SF.

This place was right down the street from the hostel I was staying at, and boy, I'm glad I stopped in. They had an overwhelming amount of sweet and savory crepes (in a good way), and lots of different coffee beverages to choose from. The food was delicious! Would definitely recommend.

Torino and eggplant crepes were acceptable but the place was a dump. 75% of the tables hadn't been cleaned and in the half hour we were there, only a couple of them were bussed. The ones that were bussed just had the plates removed; they weren't actually wiped down and cleaned properly.  I grabbed a water cup and it had lipstick stains all over the rim. There was a large clump of hair on the floor a few feet away from our table. The place looked like it hadn't been swept in days.  Will definitely NOT be going back here.

I don't know how this place got a 4.1 star overall review. There is nothing special or outstanding about this place. An unfriendly lady at the counter, making sure she doesn't smile even once and no friendly word. The atmosphere in the cafe is cold, a place you don't want to stay for long. Nothing cute or cozy, which a real creperie normally feels like. The food was bland. It was okay, not bad not great. Hot chocolate was good. If you know good creperies in other cities and are visiting the city to look for one (like we were), try to find a real French place. This one isn't it.

Incredibly long line and the took over an hour to get an omelette and sweet crepes. Wasn't  even worth it! Omelette had chunks of raw onions and the crepe was bland and mediocre. Overall, save your time and money and have a better experience elsewhere

Excellent service, great food, low prices for high quality dishes. I always get the Union Square Burger (add avocado) with curly fries. Can't be beat in this touristy area. Great crepe and breakfast options as well.

This place is so good and they have a nice selection for breakfast. Lots of choices, but you can definitely find something good. Eggs are stove of the best. Crepes are excellent. Staff is very helpful and very cool looking atmosphere.

Great food, fun menu, but what I lived was the welcome and the warmth. I am on a mobility scooter. I'm used to getting cross looks when I show up needing help with the counter service. Here I felt welcome. Thanks, y'all!

Cashier/server was frazzled, even though there was hardly anyone there. She punched in the wrong order but replaced it with the correct one without charging me again.  Food wasn't bad. Large portions. Coffee was no good.

It was good not the best breakfast. Owner was cool though but eating on the sidewalk was the best and worst experience. Peopl walking by passed too close when we were eating.  I guess the risks you take eating outside in 2020

Great food, long lines. (our wait time appx. 45 min., get there early) You have to order before you sit down and you are not allowed to save seats, they are for customers who are ordering food. A waiter/bus person gets the table ready for you as you are waiting in line and then tells you the number table to go sit at when you are ready to order. Loads of items on the menu to choose from. Filling and delicious.
Ordered a salmon bene and this is what I got.. eggs were over cooked. Very disappointing

Went on a Saturday, and waited in line about 30 mins. It went by quickly! Once we sat down, it was worth the wait. We shared the Nutella crepes, and sunrise burrito. Both were delicious!! Would definitely go back!

Fairly lively and open late. Got a chicken pesto crepe with fruit salad. Would think that a place specializing in crepes would be able to make a good batter without overcooking it. The filling was fine. Fruit was cut but stems still on it

Love this place! Wonderful breakfast choices & the most amazing orange juice I have never had. Be sure to have a look at the specials. There is a line in the morning, but it is worth the wait. And it give you time to make your mindon what to eat!

Part of the joy of traveling is discovering places like this. Great menu for any meal of the day. I popped in for a late breakfast and was completely delighted with the Cable Car omelet. Ate every bite and now need to take the long way around to the hotel to pay for the indulgence. Will be keeping this on my list of places to revisit.
The queue was massive, but the wait was well worth it.  The food was delicious (I had a chocolate waffle with bacon on the side) and the service was great.  Would definitely go again for sure.

Great place for a crepe. I personally loved my crepe with strawberries, but the lemon crepe my friend ordered was way too lemony (super sour). He couldn't finish it because of that. The other crepes were good, however.
Good food. Restruants needs updated.

As long as you go in knowing you're going to wait in line for a while, this place is a-ok. Good, not great, food at a reasonable price for the area. If it took a little less time to get your grub, this would be a 4-star for me, but the food's not quite good enough to justify the wait time in my opinion.
Breakfast was great, customer service was good also. Just make sure to get there early to get a seat because it gets pretty busy.
Great place for breakfast. Tasty food, huge selection, fast service, good price.

Came here for brunch on a Saturday and waited in line for a good twenty minutes (the line was out the door!). It’s the only place I have found with a huge array of breakfast items (crepes, omelettes, eggs, French toast, everything...) in the area. Not particularly special but, one of those places that just hits the spot.

I'm so glad we stopped here for breakfast! I seriously miss the food here. Their food is delicious and with just the right amount of seasoning! Definitely going back if I ever come back to San Francisco.
Great crepe and amazing waffle. Be inside sharp 7:30 AM if you want a early breakfast to start your day otherwise their is always a long queue cause of tourists and its amazing flavours.

Was our first time in San Francisco, Honey was the first place that we visited and our experience was really satisfied!! The food is really really good, the service is exceptional, the prices are fair! In overall was a really good experience!

The food here was generic and disappointing given the wait. This is basically no different or better than getting run of the mill diner food. The Crepe was overcooked and the eggs needed salt. I would not come back. There are many better options in the area with similar or shorter wait times.
Delicious selection, fresh ingredients, tasty coffee (per my hubby). On a Friday the service was very quick!

When we walked up and saw the line outside the door we knew there must be something special about this place. Crepes were good. Coffee was so so. Service was good. Overall a nice experience but unfortunately we’ve had better.

Pretty good food! Gets very busy so be prepared to wait! Food was alittle cold when it finally got to our table that's the only downfall but it was still good. I just hate cold breakfast food when it isnt suppose to be.

Slow service, terrible atmosphere. Food took forever, staff complained about "only a 15% tip", held back our food, and terrible system of serving. Dont go. Honestly worst part of the day was eating here.

We came in with high hopes based on some decent yelp and Google reviews. We waited for about twenty minutes outside, but the real wait came after we had ordered at the counter and PAID for our food. Not unusual to see people that order after you served before you, but we inquired anyway. Four different staff told us they would check but never came back. Remember, we've already paid. Finally I go to the counter prepared to make a scene and finally get to speak to someone who appears to be in charge. He says "sorry" and says he'll get our food out right away. Order came out wrong and was mediocre at best. They refused to refund our money. Absolutely horrible experience. AVOID THIS PLACE!

Really good food, but it was all brought together by the staff. They were busy but still friendly and helpful. Extra kudos to the man wearing a gold necklace who was serving; he was very aware of what the customers needed.
The food is really good. But definitely get there early. The orange juice is amazing!!
Love the food and the menu had great options. Didn't have to wait a long time for my food to come. Customer service was good and welcoming. Will come and visit again soon.

decent food, but service was bad, they make you stand in line to order, while tables sit empty, instead of jut seating you and taking your order. all the staff I interacted with seemed very rushed. prices are ok I guess. food was good, but nothing to write home about. coffee was pretty good. can't recommend honey honey with how the ordering process currently is.

I usually don't find restaurants giving good food near humdrum touristy areas because they know that they will get business even serving below average food. This place was impressive. Plus special mention to the hostess who was cheerful. That is unusual too for such high footfall areas where one usually gets snobbish arrogant hosts.
Had high hopes given all the high reviews. But found the savory crepes lacking flavor and the sweet crepes way too sweet to eat as a meal.
This is a no-nonsense place with great food! Fantastic staff that really helps to make you comfortable while they serve as much people as they can.

Overpriced and overhyped. The pancakes were definitely made from Krusteas just-add-water mix, and the "whipped cream" on the crepes was actually Cool Whip. Considering that breakfasts started at $8 for two eggs, I would not recommend this place.
We had a great, late breakfast here; both waffles and crepes were delicious.

The food was amazing! Great service, even though the queue was long, it went by fast and the food came out quickly! We had the "Miami Heat" and "Breakfast" crepe. I HIGHLY recommend this place for breakfast.

I think this is the Best breakfast place in San Francisco. Surely you have to wait in line to place your order at any time of the day. But it's totally worth. I usually get Sunrise Burrito with hot beans and side of home fried potato.

Very cute and easy spot for a breakfast/brunch spot. I went at 1pm ish on a Friday with no wait. We tried to return Sunday for a quick bite and the line was outside and around the corner. Food was delicious!
I'm a tourist, and i strongly recommend this place!!!
First breakfast place as tourist in SF and enjoyed. Well recomended ;)
Spanish style crepe place. Nice vibe on the corner.

Great service and a lot of delicious options! We went here for breakfast for with a group of 11 people and everyone had a great meal. Eggs, french toast, fruit, crepes, waffles, and potatoes were all outstanding!

Was excited by the menu.  The staff COMPLETELY RUINED IT.   While sitting down we were stopped stating to try to find other seating in case.  The gentleman who stopped us was assumably going to help us find said spot but instead ran off to the back while a different group of 4 took THE SAME SPOT.  The owner gave out half our order to the group that sat down next to us 20 minutes AFTER we ordered.  When even attempting to get his attention he stated 'It's coming out!'..... Well it's now been 15 mins, half the party is done eating.  Bottom line: the wait is fine, I'm willing to understand that for some places the wait is worth it, but the disorganization is an absolute killer

Absolutely scrumptious. There by 9 am on Friday waited only 30 min amazing the line moved fast. Eggs Benedict perfect Lox and bagel a winner Huevos rancheros scramble savory and delish Great speedy service Super clean
Good crepes, lines can be long when it is busy, but worth the wait!
The food is delightful! I enjoyed the iced chai tea so much I had one to go. My mom felt the chicken sausage needed more seasoning but I enjoyed it. Good place!

One of the best breaksfasts my wife and I have ever had!  Delicious!  We are in SF on our honeymoon and can’t recommend this place enough.  Prices extremely reasonable as well, which is incredibly difficult to find here.

You’ll have to wait 30 mins to 1 hour for brunch, which is normal for a weekend brunch in SF. The scramble was cooked medium-well and tasted ok. Maybe some sauce would have spruced up the meal.  I’d just get the crepes or the specials. The mimosa and bloody mary were good, tasty and worth the wait.

Exactly what I was looking for, a quick place to have a good, non-fast food breakfast.  I had the crab cake florentine: eggs were perfectly cooked though the crab cakes were a little overdone, still quite delicious.  Iced Americano was a bit bitter at first but ended up well.  Overall a good local breakfast place (and less than a block from my hotel, too!)
Beat menu at really good prices. Also the cashier Elena is a rock star. I left a key behind at the restaurant and she helped me find it. Would highly recommend

The menu is not descriptive regarding their ingredients. I originally ordered chicken parmesan which is usually made the same no matter where you go; however, here it is completely different. The chicken was not breaded and it was spicy. It also had mushrooms which is unusual for chicken parmesan. However the French fries are really delicious. The Nutella crepe was also good but would have been better if the waitress had brought the ice cream with it.

I can't comment on their whole menu, which is quite extensive, but the Strawberry Nutella crepe was spectacular! It was stuffed with fruit and nutella for a yummy combination. It was quite empty at night, but open until 10pm so it was a good stop for dessert. Not too far from Powell shops.

Cozy restaurant but seems big enough to fit larger-sized groups. Order at the front and take your number. The food came out fast and is reasonably priced. Minus one star because there was no AC when the weather hit 97F.

Cozy cafe with menus on the walls.  Breakfast, lunch and dinner served with a good variety.  They also have specials listed.  Like the crepes served with potatoes, salad or fruit.  I had the fruit and it was wonderful..bananas, strawberries and apples.  Friend had tomatoe sauce spaghetti with shrimp and it was a large serving with garlic bread.

This is one of my two favorite crape joints in the city. I haven't tried much more than crepes on the menu, but when I go with Friends or Family the other food items they order look wonderful and from bits and bites I ask friends for, I haven't tasted anything I haven't liked. I'm a very picky eater. My Friend ordered Salmon once and I couldn't try that (hate fish) but she said any Salmon eater would be impressed. I usually order the Strawberry Nutella Crepe. It's absolutely Devine. I've also had various omlett crepes. The line is rather long, depending on when you go, but it moves quickly. And from order to serve is extremely quick, and a welcome unexpectance. You can also order for delivery.

Had a catering order for about 12 people early in the morning and Abed made sure we were taken care of. Never did i have to worry if the food would be ready. The service and food was great. Came back to order from them about 5 more times and always will if I’m back in the area.

Ok food with an "affordable" price. It was still quite expensive for me but compared to the area's prices, it was pretty average.  We got there just after 8 am, the staff was not courteous and there was a bit of a line and the restaurant was quite full. We were lucky...Close to 9 am there was a line that reached outside the door.  Thank food was ok for a breakfast. Two plates of eggs woth toast and two OJ was around $20.  Price 3/5 Place 3/5 Food quality 3.5/5 Service 3/5
Our favourite breakfast spot while staying in San Francisco. The queue gets long but don’t be put off, the food arrives quickly once you do get your order in.

This is a really fun place that is jam packed every time I walked by, but I finally tried it and was really glad that I did. Crepes were so delicious, great espresso and very fast service once you get past the line. Great place to bring kids, or a family.
Great salads and tasty sandwiches. Word has it that the Belgian waffles are good as well. Our Tuesday lunch spot - order ahead for take out, as the wait time can be long

Order and pay at the counter, then food will be delivered to your table by number. Good savory and sweet crepes. A little on the loud side, between the breakfast crowd and kitchen noise. Like others said: don't be intimidated by the line.
Great food and service. We were impressed by our crepes and the shockingly good latte for under $4. Would definitely eat here again.
There breakfast croissant is a must while in San Francisco!

I would not come here again. I ordered Lox on an everything bagel. They brought me a plain bagel, with no explanation! The lox was in a glob and the center was the gray-brown fat layer between the skin and the flesh. I brought it back and the manager argued with me. Reluctantly she gave me more salmon just again to include the same gray-brown fatty fringes. Meanwhile the bagel became soft and soggy, she scraped that on a new plate and I was left without onions and capers... not accommodating, not nice people! Also, the prices in the restaurant are about $1.50 per item more then posted on their website… And there's no air conditioning, it's hot and muggy…
Haven’t even had a bite yet but the OJ is amazing and the music is fire. Staff is friendly and attentive. 10/10 would recommend!
Tip: Arrive as soon as doors open. Line quickly formed. Great Breakfast

As the first time to visit San Francisco near Union Square, and you are looking for a nice and quiet place to have breakfast and brunch. Honey Honey Cafe is a good choice. It has delicious pancakes, waffle, apple sauce sausages, and fruit.....etc. Will visit again. 😄 …

TO OWNER: COOL WHIP is just cheapo hydrogenated vegetable oil. It's disgusting and it's bad for you. Don't use it as whip cream on your crepes.  TO OWNER: The blintz crepe was gross. It was a soggy mess of sugar and something else. Barely any blintz like features. Unrecognizable. Don't call it a blintz if it's a soggy sugary mess. And it was $9.  TO OWNER: You packed our tea kettle with three times as much tea as it should have. It was like drinking pure bitter. Nice job!  OTHER THAN THAT, Breakfast crepe was good, but vegetables were not cooked?? Uncooked onions?  Crepes were soft and moist though.  This place could be great if they fixed these details.
Outstanding crepes!  Loved the Nutella Chocolate one.

Good breakfast, we had the breakfast crepes, eggs your way and the SKB sweet crepe. The sweet crepe was ok, not many kiwis. The breakfast crepe and the eggs were delicious. Good coffee, fresh squeezed OJ. Normal SF prices (a little higher than Portlabd).

I came by one morning to order their crepe suzette with a side order of vanilla ice cream to start my day, only to be greeted with a crepe drowning in freshly squeezed orange juice. The overbearing tartness of the fresh juice created a pool on my plate where the buttery flavor of my crepe drowned in. Seeing as how this place is supposed to specialize in crepes, this certainly did not make me want to go back to try out their specialty again.

For those of you from Sacramento, this place is VERY similar to Crepeville. In fact, their items on the menu and the chalk drawn menus themselves is almost a mirror image to Crepeville.  They have a large variety of crepes. We have ordered many things from the menu, never a disappointment. Food is delicious and comes out fast. My husband and I always order the Pesto and Eggplant crepe. Just be sure to avoid rush hours, as a lot of the tourists like to go there as well.

The menu choices are extensive for breakfast and lunch. The selection allows for something sweet or savory. The ordering process is a little slow and the tables are small but the food is good. We had lunch and would go back to try other menu items for breakfast.

Visited numerous times for breakfast over the course of our holiday. Great selection ( even for a vegi ) of bagels, omelettes and other breakfast food. Fast, effecient service. Just remember to order first then find a table.
Good breakfast but too much. Excellent fresh orange juice. Good pot of tea
Delicious for kids and adults! My hubby forgot to order my breakfast crepe without bell peppers and they remade it even though it was our fault. Next time I'm in the area for breakfast I'll be back!
Tasty food, excellent honey cake.
Long line but good food, right near hotels for an easy breakfast within walking distance.

Overall disappointing experience. We ordered a salad, a breakfast crepe, and egg scramble for three people, with a Nutella strawberry crepe to split. Also ordered two teas and an orange juice. The salad had a nice presentation, but you can tell the ingredients are less than quality, and it seems almost lazy. Presliced cheese, deli meat, cherry tomatoes sloppily chopped in half, and shredded carrots over lettuce. I was particularly with my breakfast crepe, which had very few eggs and way too much cheese. I ended up just eating the eggs out from the inside. My brother seemed to enjoy his scramble, but I tried it and found it strange in consistency. Luckily the Nutella crepe was actually quite good, but then again it isn’t difficult to put Nutella and strawberries on a somewhat average premade crepe batter. I would have honestly been fine with this experience if all that didn’t cost 60 dollars, the inside of the restaurant didn’t feel so cramped and unclean, and it wasn’t supposed to be one of the best breakfast spots in the city. Would not go again.
Another super popular and crowded brunch spot for tourists. The crepe with pesto is good. My friend ordered crepe Miami or something but somehow it has the flavor of alcohol .

I ate here a couple times. I had the savory pesto chicken crepe, the nutella crepe, and thre cobb salad. The salad was my favorite but all the food was good. I felt like it was a little over priced but I guess that's just Dan Francisco
Very popular! Queue to order. No table service. Loud music; cheap speakers. Espresso coffee tastes like drip coffee. Tasty scrambled eggs. Ok prices.

Coffee was wonderful, great chicken sausage, peanut butter crepe was perfect, Belgian waffle was good but not amazing but the fruit and whipped cream topping was indescribable. Definitely worth the line.

Got the breakfast crepe, they messed up my order, didnt say anything about it and brought my food out late. When I got it, it wasnt what I asked for (light cheese, just not as much as normal, I'm lactose intolerant, and they put extra), and the extremely large pieces of bell pepper and onion weren't cooked, they were raw. Wont be back, but I guess it was worth a try.
Friendly place with a wide variety of crepes. Had a savoury and a sweet crepe. Seems like a go to place for tourists.

Quite a treat awaits anyone visiting this little treasure, tucked away at an unassuming corner just down the street from SF's Union Square. Great breakfast, friendly service and even WiFi.
