Not only is the coffee barrista level, but if you like crepe, this place is a must.  The line speaks for itself, but is well worth the wait.
Loved the food, very good portions and tasty.

The number of good reviews brought me to give it a try. Tried their pesto crepe. Just not bad, in the end.  Overrated as I expected high of the restaurant.  And they're kinda under-staffed undoubtedly so service and speed is so-so.

Walked in for breakfast, walked out seven minutes later after being told we weren't in the correct line (when there had been no outside line before) and we needed to go wait outside.  A better wait system would be helpful. The Starbucks around the corner fit the bill.
This place is a hidden gem. For the price, the food was delicious and quick to arrive. As a visitor, I would be fine with breakfast here every day but I want to try out other businesses!

Good service and pleasant,busy setting. Had basic dishes - cheddar cheese omelet, apple cinnamon crepe and coffee. All was very ...basic. A lighter crepe and more syrup from the compote would be good. Food is filling.

Honey Honey has a great variety of crepes and they always update their menu! My new favorite is bounty crepe ( coconut and Nutella I think)! Also they make good chai late! However the portion size is not as good as some other places around, food needs a little bit more "decoration" and seats aren't that comfortable. In overall the place is totally worth checking out!

Went on a Friday at 9.15am.  When you enter, there is a sign that says wait to be seated.  There is a line that everyone is queuing.  I joined in anyway for a while to see what the system is.  Anyway, you order over the counter, take a number and then pick you seats.  All in all, 15-20 mins already passed.  Fortunately, my food arrived within 10 mins of ordering.  I had a 2+2+2 with the bacon and a latte.  Latte was awful.  Asked for tomato sauce and the lady just pointed to the side table (where the spare condiments are located).  I was seated at a bar because I didn't want to take a 2 seater table as there are sill people in the queue.  Most tables had condiments in it, except mine - hence my question, I didn't know where they were.  Food was so so.  Perhaps I ordered the wrong item.  I think the savoury breakfast crepes would have been better.  If you are reading this, I would suggest not paying the tips when ordering over the counter.  Pay it later if they deserve it...there ate minimal service anyway.
Food was really good!! The food was delivered less than 5 min of being seated. Service was pleasant. Overall good experience 😊 …

We don't come to SF often because we're not big city lovers, but when we do come we stop at Honey Honey to have Bfast. Their Eggs Benedict, country fries potatoes and bacon are my favorite and don't forget a crepe for dessert!
Best crepes in town! Staff is very nice. Lots of food options,and drinks. Eclectic decor. Plus freshly squeezed OJ any time. A must when in San Francisco.

This place is very busy in the morning, so go early! By 10 in the morning, there's already a line outside the door. There are a lot of options and it was hard to make a decision :) But I had the Miami Heat, and it was delicious.
They have a huge selection of crepes and other food. It is all done really well. I love the cable car scramble it is my favorite thing. The coffee is really tasty as well

Rolled up on a Sunday morning to a long line  out the door but the lady behind us said she'd been the day before and it was worth the wait--and it was! The line moved quickly, service was efficient and friendly, the portions were huge and delicious 😊 …

We had found another place to try, but when they were out of several menu options we walked back down to Honey Honey.  No limits on their menu and everyrhing was delicious and served with a smile.  I especially enjoyed their herbal tea selection and the blintz was expertly prepared. A great find!
We were group of 5 and we ate twice in it during our trip with different orders each time everything was delicious. Line is long especially if you come late. Friendly staff Highly recommended
Crab cake sandwich. Amazing. Dessert crepes were also excellent, wish they were open later than 3:00 but it is the perfect brunch spot!

Was entertaining guests here from out of town on 12/29/19 @ 8:30 am and the the food was excellent, the service was lackluster at best. The greeter was an ●●●● and we waited a week of sundays getting our food as a local I will not be returning wow!!! What a fail!!!
Great breakfast, looks busy but was able to find a seat easily after ordering. Worth making the stop for breakfast! Made our own omlete and tried the crepes.
Nice staff, nice food!
Lovely little cafe, quick service (even despite the line) and great food!

Waited so long to order and then at least half an hour for food. Then the side dish was wrong and I had to wait again. No apology, service was barely friendly. It's just such a waste of my time. Food tasted decent at least. I would not go back.
I ordered the pesto crepe and it was absolutely incredible. The ingredients complemented each other very well and tasted very fresh. Would recommend for sure.
My favour place for breakfast in SF. The breakfast is amazing specially egg omelet. The orange juice is really fresh.  The pancake is great also. I could go there everyday for breakfast

Amazing place to have breakfast in San Fransisco to be able to walk for a long time their up and down streets. Not so expensive for the quantity and quality they offer you. I will repeat again when I come back to SFO.
Very busy but I recommend arrived very early. Good food and I live the music.
Good place for breakfast. If the line is to the door, you're looking at about a 20-25 min wait. Had the Croissant Sandwich and the Two, Two & Two. Both were really good and filling.

The chicken pesto crepe was pretty bland and the waffle was the plainest I've ever had in my life. BUT, I'm going to try to go back bc the crepe itseelf was perfectly cooked and I think with something different inside it would be incredible.
This is THE spot to go to for a delectable brunch in the city!
It’s really good place !! I love it !

I had the crab cake Florentine. It was blan and the crab cakes were burnt. The potatoes were good. I would give this place a 2.5 but I don't have that option. I would get the crab cake Florentine again. Maybe I should just get there crepes.
Good for a hearty and no-fuss meal. Excellent quality, fast service, & decent prices.
The Chocolate Nutella Crepé was to die for!!! Being so close to the downtown area we managed to find this place fairly quick and my family loved it so much!!! Will be back very soon!
Delicious! great menu options, friendly service

Blant food, super expensive, super loud pop music, nice interior, but everything else is one star, my Milano ommlet supposed to have basil(seems like they have only one leave which they shred it to make looks like some basil), but I did not feel any taste of basil. I had to ask staff to pour hot tea for me, because teapot was broken and hot water pour all over the table, no paper napkins in room given except one together with fork. Staff are trying to be helpful but they are not friendly, understaffing is the obvious problem. Consider that I paid $20,35 for not tasty small size ommlett, burnt to black wheat bread, hot tea and 20 tips, I don't know how it's possible to have 4 stars rating for this place. The only plus is nice looking interior, nice name and nice looking attractive exterior.(((
Not many breakfast options on a weekday in SF, but this place was worth the wait in line. Like everything in SF it was slightly higher price than it should have been, but the food was good!

Found this place through Yelp cause we're craving for something sweet after the strenuous shopping in downtown (on a Saturday evening). No food service at 9:30pm Saturday although door sign and Yelp indicate business hours up till 10:00pm. A group of patron was finishing up at that time. We walked in and immediately told, "take out only (f*ckers)!" So much service for a banana Nutella crepe which takes less than 10 minutes to make. Nasty rude European female cashier (with tee and long uncurbed hair) who kicked us out (with her death glare) the minute we walked in. There ain't no honey in this joint, just bitterness...

Very happy with this cafe.  So many really good sounding items to choose from I could not decide.  I did settle on a California sandwich and the chai tea was Soo good.  When I visited it was not as busy but service was fast and staff was pleasant. Very happy to have stopped here.  I will visit again if I can.
Excellent food and excellent customer service! Very busy Sunday morning, long line, but we were seated and eating breakfast less than 30 min after walking through the door

Honey Honey Cafe delivers delightful simple breakfast and brunch. The extensive menu covers all the classics from eggs and Benedicts to French toast and crepes. I appreciate the fast service  and back to basics menu (refreshing in San Francisco).
Took us about an hour to get thru the line to order, get our food, and eat. Not bad for 8am. I had the Chorizo scramble, it was pretty filling and tasty. I'd get it again.

Waited 30 minutes in line to get our order in. After putting in our order, we waited another 20 minutes. We finally decided to get up to check on our food. Turns out the waiter had lost the number so didn't know where to bring our food. When we did get out food it was cold. We didn't get an apology or anything so I know I won't be going there again.

It wasn't apparent from the start, but this place is a nice little haven in an otherwise unfamiliar neighborhood. I ordered from the specials menu and enjoyed my meal with a glass of fresh-squeezed OJ. The city noise asserts itself from time to time, but it's an adventurous backdrop.
It was a nice place! The girl behind the counter was nice and they had a big selection. I was happy with my chicken sandwich and the coffee was pretty good.
Fantastic place to go for dessert. We had the crepes and it was delicious and for the price, pretty well portioned. Definitely would go back when we visit SF next time.
We make sure to eat here every time we're in SF. Love the food and location, and the service is great. The line to order might be long but it'll be worth it.
Very tasty fresh orange juice, cheddar cheese omelet was delicious as well as eggs benedict with salmon. Takes some time to stand in queue but the quality of food is very good and the price is right.

Like the idea of a crepe place in my neighborhood, disappointed with Honey Honey.  Sloppy service (idling instead of taking orders or busing tables, order mixup), and the food is overpriced (read: close enough to Union Square to charge a premium).  Fast and always oddly convenient, though!

Loved the place, good for breakfast, a bit overpriced for this type of food, but thats San Francisco 😜 There will be a line, waiting will take in average 5 minuets(thats the time you read the meneu), the food came 3-4 minuets after i ordered. …

Nice little corner restuarant, ample room with good self-seating area. Menu was huge with diverse offerings. Had the chix burritos , quite savory, wife had the nutella banana crepes which she loved. Semi-table service setup. No dedicated server, just staff floating around, bring food to table and clearing dishes.
Fast service. The huevos rancheros was sub pair, sloppy, and way to soup like. Very disappointed.  Crepe was adequate.

Looked at this online before we got into the city on vacation. So glad we stopped, the eggplant crepe was awesome! The line was long, that was the worst part, but the food came out quick once we ordered

Good food but they seem disorganised. They charged my card the wrong amount (the cashier noticed after he'd swiped the card noticed). When the food came, we didn't get quite what we ordered.  Note: long queues (30 min+) to get a table.

It's not the most comfortable of settings to eat breakfast - the decor could do with a bit of a lift but the food is well worth the visit. Chorizo scramble was delicious and pancakes are good as well.
I got the SBK crepe and it was delicious! There was a small problem with my order but they were so fast to fix it and very apologetic. Everyone was super friendly and courteous.
A great breakfast experience in SF financial District
Food was okay. Got the crab cake Benedict and regular Benedict...it was luke warm and the potatoes were cold. Coffee though made fresh was only warm. Wouldn't go back or recommend.
Good food and friendly service.
Delicious egg benedicts, nice environment. I especially like their wavy tables. My wife loved their hot cider with cinnamon. Oh, and I had to refill my cup of coffee - its good!

The bearded guy working the register was a total jerk.  This place was headed for 1 star until I had the Miami heat...by far the best crepe I've ever had.  The take service was good as well,  which redeemed it a bit more as well.
Don't be put off by the line. It moves surprisingly fast. Eggs Benedict / florentine and Potatoes were great. The Nutella crepe was delicious too (make sure to get it with their ice cream!)
Great food. Good wifi & busy at weekends for breakfast. Staff are lovely & menu is extensive. If you don't like it here you're spoilt or there is something wrong with you.

This has the look and feel of the local "Hole in the wall" eatery.  Walking distance from O'Farrell, this is a place frequented by the locals.  Food is fresh and cooked to order. The service was great and everyone was very intentive. Great place!
tasty. In door spaces out seating. The tuna sandwich was delicious. The crepe my husband had was "ok". The spinach had stems.

Don’t know what the hype is about this place, but the food is just tasteless. Our eggs benedict where a big disappointment. The muffins were dry and over burned, there was barely any sauce and the potatoes were undercooked and chewy.
Good food. Coffee was solid. Fast service and fast table turn. Definitely would go back.
Nice little cafe in downtown. Loads of places to sit and a large menu.  I got the chorizo sandwich and oh my... I was blown away. So delicious.  They serve beer here as well. Worth checking out.
Great breakfast as always. Three very cleaned plates when we were done! Eggs Benedict, Chorizo Scramble, and Chocolate Waffles all vanished in no time!
If you don't mind standing in line the food is yummy. Is it worth there wait? Depends on how hungry you were when you got in line I suppose.  I had the Belgian Waffles and a Chai with no complaints.
The food is very good and the service is great. The only thing missing is more options for morning dessert menu.

The food wasn't bad, but it wasn't good. This really feels like the Denny's of Crepe places. Very lackluster and not super high quality ingredients.  Just go to Crêpevine instead where you get twice as much food that is way better for the same price.

They publish they are open until 10 pm.  I showed up at 9:31, and they wouldn't take my order.  The person in front of me got there just ahead of me and they took their order.  And its not like there were 50 people behind me either. Disappointing. They should update their hours to reflect when you can *acquire* food, not when you can eat it.
Saw lot of tables with food left over.. kinda off putting. Can't blame the service, there were only 2 of them there looking after the whole store. Crepe was average.. Chai Latte was average.
Great place, we couldn't even eat all we ordered. Very delicious. Friendly Staff including Ukrainian Girl. It was worth waiting 30 mins to order. Thanks from Polish tourists
Super duper busy, but we were able to get a table somehow! Good service and amazing food; I recommend the Belgian waffle and their lattes!

A delicious place for brunch in the city. You'll get the millennial vibe as you enjoy brunch with snapchatters and instagrammers getting those money shots of dishes that actually deserve a post. The eggs Florentine and huevos rancheros were cooked to perfection and the baklava crepe was a uniquely tasty treat.
Crab cake Florentino was very good.  It was worth the wait of at least 30 minutes.  The potatoes are excellent much better than traditional hash browns.
Delicious and many options for a perfect breakfast
One of the best meals in San Fran. Busy, but the staff does a good job moving ppl through and making sure everyone has a table.
I got delicious breakfast here, reduced 1 star because the table and chair was not clean…

Very crowed place but seems to be a hip location. A broad menu (breakfast, lunch, snacks...) offers nice food for sb's liking. In the morning (weekend) very much people, so we waited 30 min to order our breakfast.
Just what I expected, great crepes! Expect to pay a little over $10. They offer more than just crepes, but I only had a dessert crepe. The place is much less popular at night. Take out is an option.

I usually like to find a place close to the hotel on Sunday’s and with this spot being a couple blocks away with a variety of healthy options for me I couldn’t resist a “repeat performance” and I didn’t have to have to same thing twice! Mimosa’s on deck as well and they’re always on point 🥳 …
Very good breakfast! Long line out to door, but staff is very efficient and wait is not long. Definitely will eat there again.
The food was delicious.
We had the salmon and crab Benedict’s, and a dessert crepe and it was all YUMMY!  When we arrived the line was to the door, but service was expedient, staff was helpful, friendly and fast.
Good for breakfast. Pankaces are tasty, cappuccino was good. Recommended.
Delicious!!! Amazing crepes. Great customer service, line moves fast if thier is a wait, but we'll worth it. Enjoyed the fruit infused water.
Birthday breakfast = crepe suzette.  Very tasty
Good food, but not worth the wait considering all the options around. It took almost 30 minutes just to order; and this was at 9:30 am before the town "woke up" as we were told.
French toasts lacked some taste, but pancakes were good. Not the most friendly service, but they’re polite.
A lot of breakfast options. They have savory and sweet crepes and look wonderful. Service is very efficient with some smart options like ordering before taking the table.
My wife and I had breakfast and thankfully got there before the long line formed. The crepes were excellent.  So many choices. She had the breakfast crepe with potatoes and I had the sbk.

Good food. Really nice cause we had our two kids with us and they were nice. We had a good meal and we really didn't have to worry about our kids being loud as the place is noisy. That helped us. Week be back.
Really solid crepes with a variety of flavor offerings, with extremely ample fillings. It's a hefty breakfast.
Worth the wait. The "Half Moon Bay" crabmeat stuffed mushroom crepe is delicious. Fresh orange and carrot juice plus bloody mary's too. Just go.
Menu has a good selection. The staff were friendly and helpful. The food was good. I would recommend if you are ever in the area.

Really good sweet crepe, I got Nutella and strawberries and they offer either whip cream or ice cream. Friendly staff, free WiFi. A little pricey for a crepe but it's also the neighborhood. I would return!
Best fresh juice ever but food and coffee were very okay okay, would definitely go for the juice again and again but not for anything else
The food is disgusting and the staff is really rude inside, very dirty, I definitely do not recommend.
Delicious food. Lots of people here for a Sunday lunch compared to empty places nearby. Good range of food from pancakes to burgers to huge salads. Very impressive

Me and two others are currently having mouthgasms. I feel like I haven't tried a real crepe until now. Sex and food now make sense together. Our mouths and tummies are beyond satisfied. From mimosas to savory crepes to dessert. Omg
I had an excellent Breakfast Crepe. The location is slightly small but I thoroughly enjoyed the atmosphere and was still able to carry a conversation despite the hustle and bustle.
The food was so good! Eggs Benedict were perfect. Cinnamon french toast had just the perfect blend.
Line is out the door during brunch. This place has amazing food and small restaurant charm. If you can stand the wait, you'll be rewarded with a fantastic experience.
Very good crepes and coffee.  A very long line the day we went but was handled well. Our only complaint was that the music was too loud to talk.
SBK crepe could use more sauce, it seemed a bit dry. The pesto chicken was delicious and you should definitely try their freshly squeezed orange juice !
We are big fans.  There is something for everyone who loves breakfast.  The savory crepes are special.  There is often a line to get in, but the wait is worth it.

Very nice for having breakfast. Be aware with the potatoes. If you don't like the taste of Thymian with your potatoes you better maintain it. Nice place, nice service, good food. Prices are reasonable.
Our experience at Honey Honey Cafe was not very pleasant. Maybe we hit them at the wrong time but all I ordered was a burger and I couldn't even finish it. It was greasy and lacked flavor.
Tasty place for breakfast/brunch! We had a 45 min queue but at the end understood it worthed it since the food was really good! Recomment this place for a breakfast in San Francisco
Not bad, it’s what you would expect out of a regular brunch place. Definitely go for the crepes as the specialty menu item, although the omelette wasn’t bad either.
Savory crepe uses regular sweet crepe instead of buckwheat. Was thick, doughy and oily. Also had eggs Benedict, eggs were slightly overcooked. Latte was weak.
Food was delicious.. home  made orange juice ! was really good and fresh! The waiting was about 30 min to an hour but it was worth it.  Anyways just keep an eye on the bathrooms 😔 .
While a bit loud at times, Honey Honey is an incredibly delicious crepe and sandwich experience.  Inexpensive but very well prepared food.   I would definitely eat here again.
Crepe SBK was not good. The bananas were brown, and strawberries were soggy. The whip cream was delicious. On the other hand my husband’s dulce crepe was very good.  Their chai tea latte was good.
Regular American breakfast/brunch kinda place. (Question: why do these places all have the same kind of menu art and fonts?) It was not the best but good and definitely not bad. 🤗 …
Good place to begin your afternoon. Inexpensive and not a whole bunch of atmosphere but good food.
Loud music detracts from the good food and conversation.
Took an visit here while in frisco and enjoyed it. I ordered the pecan pancakes with bananas, potatoes, some chorizo among other things. Definitely recommend to try

The food compensated for the other not so good things. It opened at 11am which it usually does not. And then there was water dripping from the ceiling in some parts. The food taste and quality was really good otherwise
The wait was 45 minutes. The people weren't very nice. The food wasn't worth the cost or the wait. It came out too cold.

Good food and location. Only taxes and charges are not clearly declared on receipt. Whenever i pay by card, it only says „service charges“ on the receipt afterwards but i still pay like 10% extra even if i did not select any tipping

Came here for breakfast as it seems to have a lot of good reviews. I got the breakfast crepe, which was nice but honestly was nothing spectacular. However, the price is great and it's certainly set me up for the day!
Food is good. However, I found a hair inside my meal, disgusting. Since it was a take out order I just threw away the rest.... Almost done by then.
Food was good. Had an omelette.  Was there on a Saturday. Therefore the queue was long. With the time it grew till the entrance. Another star less because its very loud and echoeing.
Went on Saturday morning, it was quiet and relaxing. Had the eggplant crepes which were great. Washed down well with a nice mimosa
Busy breakfast place, always seems to have a line.
The food was great but the place was kind of messy.

Naah not to my taste... i hv no idea how this place so good review. Food are pretty standard but expensive. I order pan cakes, it was so dry.. there is a spoon fool of cream they served. I mean a teaspoon. I'dnt go there...
Counter service breakfast. Good food, friendly staff and great prices. That's hard to come by in Frisco. Recommend. Beware tho this place is popular and can get quite busy.
Good spot for breakfast or brunch with decent food options and prices. It is also a fine place to come with kids as long as you avoid the popular weekend times when the line can be out the door.
Food is standard. Got eggs and country potatoes and crepes not bad. Overall safe and decent food
Lots of good options for every taste, and will certainly fill you up.
A little pricey and the portions are kinda small compared to other creapes I have had, but so delicious, and yummy French baked goods too
Food and customer service was excellent!  The line was out the door. Had the crab cake benedict. It was soooo good! Will be coming back and bringing others with me.
Ate here twice while visiting San Francisco on holidays and was pleased with the variety of menu options. The queue sometimes spills out the door so expect a wait to be served.
Nice place !The food was delicious and the size of servings were great. I would highly recommend everything about this place. Homemade and plenty of options.

Small and popular corner breakfast oriented  restaurant. The staff will find you a table while you wait in line to order. There are a lot of options to choose from for drinks and food, most of them geared towards breakfast.

Very good crepe, omelette and overall breakfast place which is extremely busy but moves the crowd efficiently so that one is not in line long to order at the counter and be subsequently served at the table.
Unpretentious diner with a huge selection of sweet and savory crepes and breakfasts. Low service, casual atmosphere. Order at the counter and your food comes out at lightning speed.
The line moved smoothly and service of the waffles was fast. You can't really go wrong with waffles, but they were fruity and not overly sweet, and excellent for breakfast.
Good food friendly service. Long line and long wait for tables is common. Great pancakes and breakfast standards. Worth standing in line for
Very nice place for breakfast. Warm and friendly. Food is plentiful and very tasty. There are many different options to choose from, a nice surprise. Moderately priced.
Great service. Friendly people. Food is good. Very long lines due to popularity but worth it! Love the freshly squeezed orange drink
The crêpes are good and the service is quick. It is a fast food kind-of restaurant though, so don't come if you're looking for a cozy calm place for brunch.
Hidden gem of a small cafe. Quick service, good food. Somewhat typical creperie-style fare plus sandwiches, but it's simple food done well.
The food is either really good or just OK, depending on the time you waiting in line to get it. Try getting there first and it's a great place for breakfast.
I absolutely loved the Belgian waffle! It tasted amazing and was so filling! The line was out the door but it was definitely worth the wait!!
Great breakfast huevos rancheros croissant sandwich pancakes and fruit - it was all good! The line is an indication that you chose a winner😀 and it moves fast. Enjoy …
If you are going on the weekend be prepared for a long line. Nevertheless, the food is great and the staff works really fast.
The tables weren't clean and the place wasn't organized either.

I was walking by this place and a little homeless lady asked me if I'd buy her a cup of coffee. Why not? I asked her what she wanted and then went in. At first, they told me that they didn't have what she wanted - a caramel latte - but apparently I just had to ask for it the "right way". It was almost like the Soup Nazi episode of Seinfeld, if I didn't ask for exactly the right thing the way that they wanted then they were going to throw me out. It was an odd, surreal experience. I guess no good deed goes unpunished. I think they even charged me an extra $1 because I know tax isn't 30%.
I came here expecting great crepes, I was very disappointed.  Thick and tasteless.

Had to wait almost an hour. The menu is huge, plenty of choice. The staff work really hard to keep up and are very polite and helpfull in explain the choices and making recommendations. Highly recommended
Had breakfast. It was exceptionally tasty. The overall rating is somewhere between good and fantastic. It is pretty cozy and has a nice relaxed atmosphere.
Food was OK, good service, but the place is not clean, restrooms are gross, one of our plates was super old looking dirty, even one cup still had lipstick on it. Disgusting.
Came here with my brother and we both loved the food! The Belgian waffles are great
Precooked eggs, barely heated raw vegetables, some diced sandwich meat, stuffed in a thick doughy crepe.  upon raising concerns I was told 'it depends on the cook'.  Yuck.
Good place to have breakfast. You line up and order.
Delicious! We had the eggs benedict and crab cake Florentine and they were amazing. A bit pricey for breakfast - but the food was definitely worth it.
We visited the location for dinner. The food choice was sufficient. The quality of the served meal was okay, but not excessive. The location looked overdue for a makeover.
I ordered banana chocolate crepe and it was delicious! Pancakes and coffee was good too! Def my fav breakfast spot in the area.
Good food good price. Unique omelette and crepe options. Self serve setup so no tip expected saves money, you pay before you eat.
Food is delicious. They forgot one of our orders. We had to remind them, but by the time it came out the others were already done eating. No apologies given.
Long wait. Food could be ok, but got some one hair and in the dish. Prices are a bit high for what you get. There are better places in town.
Line was long but it moved fast. Order at the counter then you get seated! The Lemon crepe is VERY lemony!
Terriffic experience! Food and service are memorable. Reasonable value. Wonderful selection.
I ordered crab cake florentines, and it is one of the best one I have tried in years! Although the queue could be a bit long and intimidating, the food is great and worth it!
Don't eat here plain trash
They have the best savory crepes in SF!!! Chicken pesto is my favorite but seriously every crepe dish is so good!!!
Their fresh squeezed OJ is delicious! Great environment and customer service. Whether you're looking to sit down and eat or grab something on the go, this place is ideal.

After waiting in line for 20 minutes, I got my food and realized that 20 minutes was totally worth it!!!!!!! The food is amazing, the service is perfect and the atmosphere is gorgeous! Love love love this place!
Amazing buttermilk pancakes, beautiful fresh orange

Miami HEAT! This savory crêpe had an amazing Cuban spicy sauce which needed no Tabasco enhancement, even for this spicy food lover. The soft chicken was well balanced by avocado and scallions, and the crêpe itself did its job well. Rest of the meal was good but nothing to write home about: OJ was ok, wife's pancakes were ok, chicken sausage was quite good.
The creeps were delicious! Great for breakfast, awesome for lunch. Dozens of choices. Reasonable prices. Best breakfast place I tried.

They have everything for breakfast needs!  From Granola to omlete, and from the fresh squeezed OJ to capucchino! Nice service,  spacious dining room, and honey is placed on the self-serving tray for your coffee!
Latte was good. Philly steak omelet was good. Menu is extensive. Plenty of seating. Friendly staff. Short wait time for food.
Can't get a simple door dash order correct. Only order if you want a random item on the menu.
Enjoyed my first experience there. They were very accommodating, friendly and efficient. I needed to modify my omelette and they were happy to do it!

Food was fantastic, however removed one star for how inefficient the process to get a table is. Waited in line for 45 minutes to get to place my order and then get seated even though there were many tables available.
Great place for brunch near Union Square
Absolutely fantastic food and atmosphere!!! Visiting for SoCal to watch USC beat the bears(cubs) and this place started us out right each morning...must try!
Nice place, lovely food, quick service.
Pretty busy and their menu is huge but the food was just ok
This place has DELICIOUS food. I had the Nutella and strawberry crepe. Wish I had gone back my second day, because the other breakfast place I went to didn't even light a candle to HH.
When you enter to a cafe that opens 7::30 in the morning and it's full at 8, you've come to the right place
Amazing food - particularly the breakfasts, huge portions and they have fresh squeezed orange juice available 😍, all in a relaxed atmosphere. …

This place looked good when I walked in. But as I sat down I seen the lady cleaning the coffee stand and dropped the honey cap. SHE looked around and just put it back on the honey as if nothing from the dusty floor is going to stick to the honey that I just used🤢 …
Omg the food and service was amazing order the egg benedic bagley 2 cups of amazing coffee. And every thing was delicious
Nice little cafe! Expect a wait for a table. The restaurant can only hold 46 people at a time.  The food is delicious.
Good food and friendly staff.  I went for dinner and the Mediterranean crepe hit the spot, but still left enough space to go for one of the desert crepes.
Such a huge menu but everything was delicious and fast. Great brunch or breakfast stop. The prices are perfect for what you get.
Really pleasant. Decent prices. Good quality crepe, bagel, assorted breakfasts. Really enjoyed my cappuccino.
Good food, quick service! Breakfast isn't hard, but they have a good menu and fresh ingredients. Will go back for sure.
Line was on the street, but the food was good. Different from what I'm used to being from Memphis, but still good.
Absolute madhouse during the brunch rush! But for good reason, they really care about their customers and serve them high quality food. Great selection and unique options.
Poor service.  Staff was to busy talking to each other. Staff made me change three different times.  Felt like an inconvenience.
Shoutout to Mohammed who worked tirelessly and manage to multi-task effortlessly! Food was excellent!
Great breakfast. Eggs benedict and Mediterranean Crepe were fantastic. Highly recommended.
Worth the wait in line!
Great food.  There was a long line when we visited, but that's a sign of good food.  Definitely worth the wait.
Good menu. Tasty food. Prime location. Free WiFi if you wanna work. Good music. Would definitely come back.
Ordered Pesto Crepe, Blintz Crepe and tofu scramble breakfast items. We didn't like any of it.    Of the 3, Pesto Crepe was decent
Good food. Loved the fresh orange juice. Expect long queues.
Great food. Excellent service. Fair prices. Try the croissant breakfast sandwich, you won't be sorry. :)
I cannot praise this place enough... There is a reason there are long queues every morning! Great service,  lovely owners,  great food, value for money...  Best place in dowtown for breakfast!!
This place is cool, they could clean the light fixtures and the cashier is very aggressive. The pancakes was good... The seating is cram.
They have long list of foods I think they can be better Pepper potatoes was like very fast food type The rest was pretty Good
One of the best breakfasts in the area, delicious, diverse menu options. Worth the long wait you may face some days.
Went there for breakfast and wasnt dissapointed. Typical american breakfast with beacon and egg. Orange juice is pressed freshly aswell. However its rather expensive there.
Tasty but a bit dry sandwiches, could use more sauce or a dipper. The potato salad was mediocre.  The staff is very friendly!

I needed a fresh squeezed juice and latte and that's what I got. Quickly, I should add. I wish more juice options existed but I'm all out of magic lamps. It was a delightful juice and latte so thank you.

Vast menu selection, fast service, delicious food (I got the Huevos Rancheros and a side of chorizo with an Anchor Steam beer to wash it down) and friendly service. Reasonably priced for the portions as well.
Great bloody mary's! I had their Santa Fe special and it was deliciously spicy! There is a wait during the breakfast rush but it is worth it!
It's fast, good food and good people! I recommend
This place is really good, but for whatever reason the service is really slow, resulting in very long lines.  While the food is good, it's not good enough to wait more than fifteen minutes in line.
Loved their breakfast menu. Coffee could be a little better. Only one girl taking orders and also making coffee. Over all love the food.
Absolutely delicious food, big portions, fluid service. Just wait in line, order at the register and they'll have a table ready for you by the time you place your order.
Eggs Benedict are great!
There is always pretty long queue. Surprisingly works pretty good to find empty table. It took some time prepare the food but was excellent.
Worth the wait online very friendly service the food was very tasty..

Ordered an omelet and huevos rancheros. The omelet was eggs from a carton and the veggies were uncooked (from a can) and laid inside the egg,  not cooked into the egg. The huevos was not fresh, canned salsa and poorly warmed can beans. Didn't finish either.
Very busy, but the line out the door went by quickly. The crepes are delicious, with a great selection of savory and non savory options.

This place is highly recommended I said at the Fitzgerald it was literally across the corner Fitzgerald was a nice cheap hotel but when I got there they had so much selections my wife got the hazelnut Crepes and I got the breakfast I got the breakfast omelettes the continental and it was amazing you have to go
Great food and atmosphere here! You seat yourself so be prepared to make space for yourself/your group or come at a less busy time.
Got one (1) pancake for $9. Not sure, is this a joke? The tea was good though, that gets a second star. Why does this place even exist? Ugh.
It was dark and their menu didn't seemed appetizing. I walked out and had Delicious coffee and a yummy croissant sandwich at FarmTable two blocks away.
What a cafe. So many breakfast items to select. A must go eatery place when roaming SFo downtown. From eggs to crepes, they have everything!
Always a delicious spot. Eat here every time I’m in SF
Very nice and effective cafe; the line is long, but fast, and there are always empty seats and the food is of an adequate quality, compared to the price and location
We have eaten here every morning for 4 days and had lunch there today. We will probably eat there the next 3 days . So yeah very good.
Good place for good breakfast. They have a big nice menu, and I liked latte there
Great crêpe, also staff was excellent!
We had pancakes, omelette and bagels. All were delicious and the portions are huge. Great value for money!
Fast service, great breakfast options for entire family, tasty food, and coffee that tastes like coffee, all for a reasonable price.
Great food and atmosphere! Had the SBK and 2 and 2 and 2, check it out...and they make a great cup of cappuccino!
Very long line and waiting times but the food is good.
Standard SF creperie. Their blintz is a little weird; it's made with cottage cheese (in addition to ricotta). Good selection of teas and solid egg dishes.
The service was good, but I've had better eggs Benedict. Their menu is fantastic and great for brunch.
Food was okay. It's pretty pricey tbh. But it does fill you up.
